definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: By comparison, Dicos to enter the threshold is much more flexible.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，德克士的进入门槛则灵活得多。

sentences.english: His work has received relatively little attention from academic critics.
sentences.chinese: 而相比较而言，学院派评论家很少关注他。

sentences.english: The principle of non bis in idem are more in accord with the reality of China.
sentences.chinese: 比较而言，一事不再理原则更符合我国的实际。

sentences.english: In comparison, the Monkey King is a lone ranger.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，孙悟空是一个孤胆英雄。

sentences.english: We were good children, relatively speaking.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，我们还算是好孩子。

sentences.english: That compares with an annualized return of about 10% for a typical agreed-on deal.
sentences.chinese: 比较而言，一般商定交易的年化收益率在10%左右。

sentences.english: By comparison, Alec was the least ambitious man she had ever met.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，艾里克是她见到的最没有雄心壮志的人。

sentences.english: Comparatively speaking, China's central and western urban-rural gap is even more prominent issues.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，我国中西部城乡差距拉大问题更为突出。

sentences.english: Compared to Kendall' s W, intraclass correlation coefficients have a wide scope of application.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，组内相关系数检验的应用前景更广阔。

sentences.english: In comparison, Google's share was merely around 16 percent.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，谷歌的份额只占到约16%。

sentences.english: So try your best to have a happy Memorial Day weekend, relatively speaking.
sentences.chinese: 比较而言，还是尽力享受一个快乐周末吧。

sentences.english: China's soccer team, by contrast, is a perennial disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，中国国足却叫中国人连年失望。

definition: to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
fall short by a large amount
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to predominate/to occupy a dominant position
to stress in a prejudiced way/to emphasize sth unduly
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
